items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Physical NatGas Finds Footing as Old Man Winter Awakens
items.summary: Next-day cash prices bounced back on Tuesday as natural gas buyers braced for multiple bouts of frosty air during the second half of January.

items.title: Futures Settle: Strong Supply Checks February Natural Gas Prices
items.summary: Forecasts for northern chills barely budged front month natural gas futures on Tuesday. Abundant supply anchored the market.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Natural Gas Cash Prices Strengthen as Cooler Weather Approaches
items.summary: As intraday weather model updates reinforced expectations for chillier temperatures ahead, natural gas spot prices posted solid gains on Tuesday despite robust supply.

items.title: While Neighbors Race for Natural Gas, U.S. Oil Giants Hesitate on Venezuela
items.summary: Despite a potential historic opening in Venezuela’s energy sector, major U.S. oil and gas companies are remaining cautious.

items.title: EIA Slashes Natural Gas Price Outlook as Mild Weather Saps Winter Heating Demand
items.summary: Benchmark U.S. natural gas spot prices could average sharply lower than previously forecast this winter as mild temperatures curb heating demand, though price strength is expected to return in 2027 on the back of rising LNG exports and power demand,

items.title: U.S. to Asia LNG Arb Near One-Year Low as Global Natural Gas Flows Continue Shift
items.summary: Russia's Gazprom PJSC said it again broke a record for daily natural gas supplies delivered to China on the Power of Siberia (POS) pipeline this week as its flows continue to shift eastward in an ongoing shakeup of the global natural gas market.

items.title: MidMorning Market: Coal-to-Gas Switching Potential, Weather Demand Combine to Lift Natural Gas Futures
items.summary: Prompt month natural gas futures slipped Tuesday after early gains failed to extend Monday’s rally, which had been supported by stronger weather-driven demand and potential coal-to-gas switching.

items.title: Expand Chief Says $3.50 Natural Gas Unlikely to Spur Aggressive Growth
items.summary: Expand Energy Corp. CEO Nick Dell’Osso sees a U.S. natural gas market that remains volatile in the near term but structurally constructive as producers navigate supply growth, shifting basin dynamics and an increasingly global demand outlook tied to

items.title: Does Natural Gas Pipeline Flow Data Matter? For Supply and Demand Clarity, It’s a Must
items.summary: Monitoring electronic bulletin boards to review natural gas pipeline notices can be an arduous task. To make informed decisions, though, the energy industry has found value in comprehending a key metric of the supply and demand picture.

items.title: Venezuelan Oil and the Limits of U.S. Refining Capacity
items.summary: Last week, U.S. President Donald Trump’s Venezuela pitch to oil executives to invest the vast sums required to revive the country’s flagging oil sector proved largely ineffectual. Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) CEO Darren Woods offered the starkest assessmen

items.title: Trump’s Venezuela Takeover Will Make Guyana Oil Safer

items.title: Large Crude, Product Builds Weigh on Oil Prices
items.summary: The American Petroleum Institute (API) estimated that crude oil inventories in the United States saw a build of 5.27 million barrels in the week ending January 9. Crude oil inventories sagged by 2.8 million barrels in the week prior. The Department o

items.title: Iran Turmoil Resurrects Specter of Critical Oil Lane Disruption

items.title: WTI and Brent Rise as Geopolitics and Washington Rattle the Market
items.summary: Oil prices pushed higher on Tuesday afternoon, with traders weighing a familiar but combustible mix of Middle East risk and Washington-driven policy uncertainty. As of 2:34 p.m. ET, U.S. benchmark WTI crude was trading around $61.10 per barrel, up ro

items.title: Trump’s Venezuela Oil Plan Runs Into Hard Reality
items.summary: Last week US President Donald Trump announced that Venezuela’s interim authorities will turn over up to 50 million barrels of oil to the United States, before later declaring his administration will control Venezuela's oil sales “indefinitely”. Decry
